questions.question: The top layer of the Earth is called
Before there was evidence from rocks and fossils,many scientists theorized that the continents were once joined together

choices.answer: the shapes of the continents allowed them to fit together.
weathering and erosion have reshaped the surface of the Earth.
the oceans have become smaller throughout Earth’s history.
the continents were all bordered by mountain ranges.

questions.question: Which of the following provides evidence for past tectonic plate motions?

choices.answer: Matching rock type and rock formations can show the way the continents were
Glacial evidence has been found in areas where glaciers could not exist if
Ancient life forms preserved as fossils can tell us what organisms existed

questions.question: Evidence to support that some plates have traveled great distances comes from the fact that –

choices.answer: fossils of organisms that lived in warm climates have been found in arctic
species of organisms in the fossil record have changed over geologic time.
some fossilized organisms have only been found on one continent.
the oldest known fossils represent ocean organisms

questions.question: The theory of plate tectonics was, at first, rejected by most scientists. Now most geologists accept this theory

choices.answer: New evidence was discovered that made scientists revise their ideas.
Tectonic plates have begun to move faster and faster over time.
There are more people studying science now than in the past.
Scientists can now travel underneath the plates and observe their motion.

questions.question: Tectonic plates of the lithosphere float on top of the asthenosphere,

choices.answer: as they are less dense than the material of the asthenosphere.
as they are more dense than the material of the asthenosphere.

questions.question: How are scientists able to determine changes in position of Earth's landmasses over geologic time?

choices.answer: Evidence from rocks, glaciers and fossils

questions.question: There is an idea or theory that the large masses of land all over Earth were at one time all connected as the Pangaea, o
The theory that the outer layer of Earth is divided and moves across Earth’s surface
